review_title: Used to be a great company
pros:
Some of the relationships you establish with colleagues in other branches and areas within the company.
Benefits are good
cons:
-Very low merit increases
-Management now consists of people with NO experience in luxury retail, in luxury jewelry or in sales as a whole
-Management is now hired based on the common interests of the potential employee and hiring manager as or based on who 'looks the part' rather than who can DO the part
-This new management never wants to promote existing employee with many years of experience because they only have about one year in the company themselves so of course they do not want someone with 10 or more years experience to be hired
-A 'diversity' management program was put into place to get more 'diverse' people in management again, however there was only one African-American included out of ALL of the African-American employees that have had more than 10 years with the company. The program was never discussed with existing employees at all to understand what the program was really about.  It basically came about due to a public lawsuit filed by an African-American employee.  There were also not many Latinos included in this program either.  
-No longer does this company have people of color in management
-Management has no experience due to more outside hiring of people 
-Product has gotten very cheap over the years which makes it difficult to justify the price 
-Lost it's luster
-Management, due to lack of experience, does not have solutions to things they 'think' you need to work on only questions.  If the employee knew how to fix the so called 'problem' I think it would be fixed already.  Asking what can you do to help really isn't what a manager does.  Managers are supposed to have solutions based on their experience and expertise in the area.

pros: this company is one of the best I have ever had the pleasure of working for. benefits are the best and pay is well.
